Tune Feature Combination

Source: R/tuneFC.R
tuneFC.Rd

The function iterates among different Feature Classes combinations and for each of them performs trains a different MaxEnt model.

tuneFC(model, fcs, metric = c("auc", "tss", "aicc"), test = NULL,
  env = NULL, parallel = FALSE)

Arguments

model

SDMmodel or SWDmodelCV object.
fcs

vector with all the Feature Classes combination to be tested.
metric

character. The metric used to evaluate the models, possible values are: "auc", "tss" and "aicc", default is "auc".
test

SWD. Test dataset used to evaluate the model, not used with aicc and SDMmodelCV objects, default is NULL.
env

stack containing the environmental variables, used only with "aicc", default is NULL.
parallel

logical, if TRUE it uses parallel computation, deafult is FALSE. Used only with AICc.

Value

A SDMtune object.

Details

You need package snow to use parallel computation and rgdal to save the prediction in a raster file. Parallel computation increases the speed only for big datasets due to the time necessary to create the cluster.

See also

Other tuning functions: tuneBg, tuneReg

Examples

# NOT RUN {
fc_test <- tuneFC(model, fcs = c("l", "lq", "lqp"), metric = "aicc",
env = predictors, parallel = T)
# }
